View

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • View.View
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdminAddShowTimeView, AdminChangeMovieInfoView, AdminConfigurePublicHolidayView, AdminCreateNewMovieView, AdminMainMenuView, AdminSystemSettingsView, BaseListMoviesView, BaseMovieBrowseOptionsView, MainMenuView, MovieDetailView, MovieGoerBookingFilterShowtimesView, MovieGoerBookingHistoryView, MovieGoerBookingListShowTimesView, MovieGoerBookingPurchaseTicketView, MovieGoerBookingSeatSelectionView, MovieGoerLeaveReviewView, MovieGoerListReviewsView, MovieGoerView, MovieViewingView

    public abstract class View
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the base View class. All the subsequent views class will be the subclasses of this class. This class helps to define the basic structure of View in our application. A View has 3 basic components: the title, the view content as well as the options for user to choose and interact with.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> options
      This is the list of options available for users in the View
      private java.lang.String title
      This is the View title
      private java.lang.String viewContent
      This is the View String content

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      This activate method makes the View state to be active, in which the View will print out its title, menu and options in the console.
      protected void printOptions()
      This method helps to print the View options
      protected void printViewContent()
      This method helps to print the View content
      protected void printViewTitle()
      This method helps to print the View title
      protected abstract void processUserInput(int input)
      This method helps to handle user input when user choose one of the options in the View
      void setOptions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> options)
      This method allows subclasses to set the View options that are available for users to interact with
      void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
      This method allows subclasses to set the title of the View
      void setViewContent(java.lang.String content)
      This method allows subclasses to set the view content of the View

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setViewContent

        public void setViewContent(java.lang.String content)
        This method allows subclasses to set the view content of the View
        Parameters:
        content - The string content to be printed as the View content

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        This method allows subclasses to set the title of the View
        Parameters:
        title - The title to be printed on top of the View

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> options)
        This method allows subclasses to set the View options that are available for users to interact with
        Parameters:
        options - The options to be printed for users to choose

      • activate

        public void activate()
        This activate method makes the View state to be active, in which the View will print out its title, menu and options in the console.

      • processUserInput

        protected abstract void processUserInput(int input)
        This method helps to handle user input when user choose one of the options in the View
        Parameters:
        input - the index of the options
